pageContext.claim: “At the end of the last administration, the Congressional Budget Office projected fewer than 2 million jobs would be created in three years. Well, we did a little bit better than that. We created seven million -- and actually it'll be close to 8 million jobs by the time the final numbers came in.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump did exceed the CBO's calculations but his numbers are wrong. The CBO projected 2.8 million jobs in the next two years, not less than 2 million over three years. And only 6.7 million jobs, not 8 million, were created under his tenure before the pandemic struck.
